TextBody:
Hi Anoush,

Please let us know if you are using SSO solutions like OKTA or Azure SSO. Also, mention of 2FA is enabled.
Also, the auto-fill solution sometimes causes this kind of issue as it automatically sends the user to the next authentication step.

For testing purposes, please try to introduce the password manually or copy/paste it for a while, and see if the issue still persists.

Best Regards,
Iosif Muntean| Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
 www.endpointprotector.com

Ticket Number: 00426806 Ticket Subject: Login Errors Ticket Details: I was directed to submit a ticket by our account rep Nadine Guthrie. When logging in to https://5jfh4tl.hosted.endpointprotector.com/ using my credentials for adorville@segalbenz.com, I frequently get bounced to an login error page that either says: The username or password you entered is incorrect. Go back to the login page. OR Unfortunately, the login process encountered an error. Please try again The behavior is not consistent but my password is since I am auto-filling that from my 1Password entry for Endpoint Protector. Please let me know what other information you need to troubleshoot this. Thank you! Iosif Muntean Technical Support Engineer Tier 1 ____________________ _________ Cybersecurity That Works for You 6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034 www.netwrix.com ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0ICzDU:ref [ image263605.png (image/png) ] [ image243785.png (image/png) ] [ image552441.png (image/png) ] [ image503140.png (image/png) ] [ image565255.png (image/png) ]

Ticket Number: 00426806 Ticket Subject: Login Errors Ticket Details: I was directed to submit a ticket by our account rep Nadine Guthrie. When logging in to https://5jfh4tl.hosted.endpointprotector.com/ using my credentials for adorville@segalbenz.com, I frequently get bounced to an login error page that either says: The username or password you entered is incorrect. Go back to the login page. OR Unfortunately, the login process encountered an error. Please try again The behavior is not consistent but my password is since I am auto-filling that from my 1Password entry for Endpoint Protector. Please let me know what other information you need to troubleshoot this. Thank you!
